title: Close Brothers Group Faces Credit Rating Affirmation with Negative Outlook
body:
**Fitch Affirms Close Brothers Group at 'BBB'; Outlook Negative**

On December 15, 2025, Fitch Ratings affirmed Close Brothers Group PLC's (CBG) Long-Term Issuer Default Rating at 'BBB' with a Negative Outlook. The affirmation reflects challenges in CBG's motor finance lending and strategic execution risks. The Negative Outlook indicates uncertainties surrounding the group's restructuring and potential impacts from the Financial Conduct Authority's review of historical motor finance commission arrangements. ([tradingview.com](https://www.tradingview.com/news/reuters.com%2C2025-12-15%3Anewsml_FIT5N8wpd%3A0-fitch-affirms-close-brothers-group-at-bbb-outlook-negative/?utm_source=openai))

**Analyst Downgrades and Share Price Impact**

In recent months, Close Brothers Group has experienced analyst downgrades affecting its share price. On October 12, 2025, Keefe, Bruyette & Woods lowered their price target from GBX 640 to GBX 580, leading to a 12.8% decline in the stock. ([defenseworld.net](https://www.defenseworld.net/2025/10/12/close-brothers-group-loncbg-stock-price-down-12-8-on-analyst-downgrade.html?utm_source=openai)) Additionally, RBC Capital Markets downgraded the stock to 'sector perform' from 'outperform' on August 18, 2025, following a significant share price rally earlier in the year. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/rbc-downgrades-close-brothers-group-to-sector-perform-after-120-share-rally-4196773?utm_source=openai))

**Postponement of 2025 Preliminary Results**

On September 19, 2025, Close Brothers Group announced a one-week delay in releasing its preliminary results for the year ended July 31, 2025. The postponement was attributed to the group's auditor requesting additional time to complete standard audit procedures. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/news/company-news/close-brothers-postpones-2025-preliminary-results-by-one-week-93CH-4246069?utm_source=openai))

key_points.text: Fitch Ratings affirmed Close Brothers Group's 'BBB' rating with a Negative Outlook due to challenges in motor finance lending and strategic execution risks.
Analyst downgrades from Keefe, Bruyette & Woods and RBC Capital Markets led to significant declines in Close Brothers Group's share price.
Close Brothers Group postponed its 2025 preliminary results release by one week to allow auditors additional time for standard procedures.
